## What this sample does
This program creates instances of `mclBnFr`, `mclBnG1` and `mclBnG2` for 3 times and shows the contents first.

Then it calls `blsInit` and repeat the same procedure inserting a call to clear function for each type before printing out the contents.

## Symptom
When an instance is instantiated, the initial value slightly differ from one another. Also if the program is executed again, all the values differ from those of previous execution.

After `blsInit` is called and clear function is called, all the contents are zero-ed out and this remains the same.

## Output example

## Environment
- x86_64
- Ubuntu 20.04
- gcc version 9.4.0 (Ubuntu 9.4.0-1ubuntu1~20.04.1)

## How to reproduce the symptom
```sh
$ make
$ make run
```
